item.description:
Part 5 of the Massachusetts Appalachian Trail! We get to cross the Mass Pike on this section! Join us on Saturday September 10th to do the fifth part of a series of hikes that I will be scheduling to do the entire length of the Massachusetts Appalachian Trail. We will meet at the AT trail head on route 20 5 miles east of downtown Lee, which will be the ending location of our hike. We'll then leave half the cars and drive over to the AT trail head Main Road in Tyringham (the ending location of the last hike). The total distance of this hike is 8.6 miles.....total elevation gain is about 1300 ft. Based on our past hiking speeds this will be about a 5 to 6 hour hike.

 

Total Mass AT Hiked Before this section: 34.7 out of 89.7 39% Total Mass AT Hiked After this section: 43.3 out of 89.7 48%

 

Is This Hike for Me?

This is a moderate length hike with some elevation gain. Please bring plenty of water (I'm bringing 3 liters) appropriate hiking attire (no jeans or cotton, hiking boots not sneakers), rain gear in case the weather turns nasty, lunch, and snacks. 

 

Trailhead Directions

From Providence 2 hours 10 minutes

From Newport 2 hours 45 minutes

Trailhead lat/lon: 42.291437,-73.157047

The trail head parking lot is route 20 (called Cape st here) just east of the intersection with Becket rd. It is about 5 miles east of Lee. Get off Mass Pike at exit 2 and take rt 20 5 miles east. Google Maps link to the location:

http://maps.google.com/maps?q=2300+cape+st+Lee+MA&hl=en&ll=42.293088,-73.15944&spn=0.013698,0.02605&sll=42.289564,-73.154461&sspn=0.013699,0.02605&gl=us&z=16

 

Street view of trail:

http://maps.google.com/maps?q=42.291644,-73.157229&ll=42.293096,-73.161253&spn=0.006849,0.013025&sll=42.291479,-73.157401&sspn=0.013698,0.02605&layer=c&cbp=13,294.16,,0,8.73&c...

 

 

Trail  Route Information (starting from Main Road, Tyringham)

1.7 miles to Baldy Mountain (1873 ft)

2.6 miles to Goose Pond Road

1.9 miles to Goose Pond Inlet

2.0 miles to bridge over Mass Pike

0.4 miles to rt 20

 

 

Carpool Option

Please use the comments section to coordinate with other hikers if you want to carpool. There is limited parking so car pooling is recommended....just remember that we do have to carspot.

 

Massachusetts Appalachian Trail Series

MAP NOTE: What we have hiked is in black, current section in red, remaining trail red dots.

 

 

Liability Waiver

As a condition of your voluntary participation in this activity you acknowledge and agree to the following: this activity involves inherent risks that can cause property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death to participants and/or others; you assume all risk associated with this activity; you are responsible for having the necessary knowledge, skills, abilities, clothing, and equipment to safely participate in this activity; you know and will follow the Hiker Responsibility Code described at www.hikesafe.com; the leader(s) of this activity are volunteers; and you for yourself, your heirs, executors, and administrators release, hold harmless, and indemnify the leader(s) and all members of this group from any and all claims for property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death - including those caused by negligence and/or other reasons.
item.how_to_find_us: AT Trailhead on rt 20in Lee, look for a grey Nissan Juke with RI plates. Cell: 508-414-8544. See directions below.
item.name: Massachusetts Appalachian Trail: Part 5
